properties.title: DOCLET: JUnit report include JavaDoc : Ojido-kun UT5
properties.author: Toshikazu Ando.

section.name: DOCLET: JUnit report include JavaDoc : Ojido-kun UT5
section.p:
I created the JUnitReport for ant task.
But those file are not include JavaDoc ;-)
So I create JUnit report include JavaDoc using JavaDoclet technology (Sample1,Sample2(Solution)).

section.name: How to use
section.p: 1st step: create the java source code.
Next step: write build.xml the following text. (For JUnit)
section.source: <path id="common.classpath"> <pathelement path="C:\eclipse\plugins\org.hamcrest.core_1.3.0.v201303031735.jar" /> <pathelement path="C:\eclipse\plugins\org.junit_4.12.0.v201504281640/junit.jar" /> <pathelement path="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_77\lib\tools.jar" /> <pathelement location="./classes" /> </path> <target name="all"> <mkdir dir="./target/" /> <delete dir="./target/junit" /> <mkdir dir="./target/junit" /> <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="no"> <classpath refid="common.classpath" /> <formatter type="xml" /> <batchtest fork="yes" todir="./target/junit"> <fileset dir="./src/test/java"> <include name="**/*Test.java" /> </fileset> </batchtest> </junit>
section.p: Last step: write build.xml the following text. (For output report)
section.source: <delete dir="./target/ut5" /> <mkdir dir="./target/ut5" /> <javadoc destdir="./target/ut5" encoding="UTF-8" docencoding="UTF-8" additionalparam="-J-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8" charset="UTF-8"> <classpath refid="common.classpath" /> <packageset dir="src/test/java"> <include name="jp/**" /> </packageset> <doclet name="jp.ruru.park.ando.ut5.UT5Doclet" path="lib/UT5DocLet.jar"> <param name="-junit" value="./target/junit" /> </doclet> </javadoc>

section.name: junittree option
section.source: <delete dir="./target/ut5" /> <mkdir dir="./target/ut5" /> <javadoc destdir="./target/ut5" encoding="UTF-8" docencoding="UTF-8" additionalparam="-J-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8" charset="UTF-8"> <classpath refid="common.classpath" /> <packageset dir="src/test/java"> <include name="jp/**" /> </packageset> <doclet name="jp.ruru.park.ando.ut5.UT5Doclet" path="lib/UT5DocLet.jar"> <param name="-junit" value="./target/junit" /> <param name="-junittree" value="abdegh cf r i j tt s nqq l" /> </doclet> </javadoc>
